pages.text: Phasing allows parasites to permeate through solid matter, allowing them to 'swim' through solid surfaces or occaisonally void incoming projectiles.

It is most commonly applied by a nearby active $(l:blocks/dendritus)Dendritus$(). The effect cannot pierce all blocks, however, as not only is it based on the parasite's block breaking capabilities, but there are also some blocks that simply can't be phased through, such as End Stone.
